heading: JVP vows to expose PM's connection to Bond Scam
content: COLOMBO (News 1st): The JVP leader Anura Kumara Dissanayake recently commented on a series of matters, ranging from the economy to  a recent media briefing by the former President.MP Dissanayake said that there is “no point in speaking about Ravi Karunanayake, Malik Samarawickrama, Lakshman Kiriella or even Moneragala Zoysa” without speaking about the sale of “certain resources”. Then the MP turned his attention towards the former President, saying “If we speak of Mahinda we will have to speak about the expose’s on the theft that had taken place during his administration”.MP Anura Kumara stated that both camps have proved that they “cannot build the country”.He then spoke on the media briefing convened by the former President, recalling a “valid question” by a journalist on the present status of the rupee.“Next to him (MR) was Weerawansa, no point asking him. The other side was also the same. Cabraal who was seated behind him whispered something to his ear. Mahinda repeats whatever is whispered to his ear. Are they leaders?”, added MP Anura KumaraMP Dissanayake also pointed out the response when a journalist questioned about Keith Noyahr while the former President was speaking about the North: “Then he says there is no connection between the economy and Keith Noyahr. But the Northern Elections is connected to the economy according to him. These are people who only respond to matters that benefit them and refuse to answer on matters that don’t benefit them…”The JVP leader also commented on the present state of affairs.He pointed out that foreign nations have already taken over Sri Lanka and that the Singapore FTA had been signed to satisfy the needs of other countries. MP Anura Kumara also stated that fmr. President Mahinda Rajapaksa went to India in a bid to draw plans to build the next government.“There was an issue with the President and the Prime Minister. The Prime Minister goes and meets with the US Ambassador. When the budget speech was delivered, two members from the IMF were seated in the gallery. Rajapaksa and Ranil Wickremesinghe are thieves. I will prove it. Aren’t Kiriella , Ravi Karunanayake, Basil Rajapaksa thieves? Can anyone say they are not thieves? These are people who looted public funds to the tune of billions. We are prepared to prove it to the country.” he added.MP Anura Kumara also spoke about the “group of thieves” governing this country.“A case on the bond scam will not be filed against Ranil Wickremesinghe. But, if they file a case because I said, Ranil Wickremesinghe can meet me in court and on that day I will prove his connection to the Bond Scam …” – said the JVP leader.

heading: President to address 73rd session of UNGA tomorrow
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The 73rd session of the United Nations General Assembly will begin today (September 24) at the United Nations Headquarters in New York.This year’s UNGA session is themed, “Making the United Nations Relevant to All People: Global Leadership and shared responsibilities for Peaceful, Equitable and Sustainable Societies.”Representatives from 193 countries of the United Nations will take part in this year’s UN General Assembly. As the assembly’s new president, Ecuador’s former foreign minister Maria Fernanda Espinosa Garces will lead this week’s annual general debate which would take place for nine days.International Media reports suggest that diplomats will be focusing their discussions on world peace at the top of the agenda.President Sirisena will be one of the prominent speakers at the Nelson Mandela Peace Summit, the most important global peace event organized on the sidelines of the 73rd Session of the United Nations General Assembly.The President will address the 73rd Session of the United Nations General Assembly tomorrow (September 25). This will be his fourth consecutive annual address to the world body.

heading: Was Angelo Mathews a scapegoat?
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) Sri Lanka Cricket has announced that the National Selectors decided to appoint Dinesh Chandimal as the ODI captain to lead the team in the upcoming series against England. Accordingly, they have requested Angelo Mathews to relinquish his duties as the National ODI & T20I captain, with immediate effect.Angelo Mathews had then announced his resignation as skipper in an open letter, in which he said that he is relinquishing his duties as Captain as per the request made by the selection committee and the coach. Mathews says it was immediately felt that he was made the scapegoat in the entire saga of Sri Lanka’s dismal performances against Bangladesh and Afghanistan in the Asia Cup. He goes on to state that all decisions are taken through a mutual understanding with the Selectors and the Head Coach.The letter states that, though he does not agree with the reasoning that the losses should be accrued single-handed to the Captaincy, he eagerly and wholeheartedly respects the request of the selection committee and the head coach in asking him to step down with immediate effect. He also stated that during his captaincy, series wins recorded against England, a whitewashing of Australia 3-0 and winning the Asia Cup in 2014 were some of the memorable occasions.Mathews also pointed out that despite multiple captains being appointed to Sri Lanka Cricket from July 2017 none of them have been able take on the mantle in a permanenent role.The multiple captains mentioned by Mathews are;Upul TharangaThisara PereraChamara KapugedaraLasith MalingaDinesh ChandimalThe letter says he had no intention of continuing to play as Captain of the National Team.He also stated that Chandika Hathurusinghe met with him immediately after being appointed as Head coach, and requested to reconsider taking up the Captaincy until the World Cup in 2019.Mathews says that though family and close friends discouraged him from taking up the mantle, being confident in Hathurusinghe and his plans to elevate the performances of the Sri Lankan team and in the best interest of the country he agreed to do so until the World Cup.He says though Sri Lanka suffered these heavy defeats in the Asia Cup, especially in the backdrop of a reasonable series against South Africa, he had no intention in quitting and running away from the issues at hand, especially owing with the World Cup being only a dozen games away.A word from a former captainFormer Test Cricket Captain and present Minister Arjuna Ranatunga stated that he was trained during the time of Duleep Mendis and Roy Dias, who trained Aravinda and Madugalla.“After they retired, we came into captaincy and created players like Sanath and Marvan. When Sanath and Marvan came into captaincy they trained people like Mahela and Sangakkara. But during Sangakkara’s time, they did not create new players who can take the mantle forward. They did unnecessary things to Chandimal and Thirimanne. That player was ruined. We saw how even Mathews was treated. They did not allow players to rise. This is the result of that. There are no key batsmen when Mathews captains and when Chandimal is injured” he added.

heading: 4 schools used for G.C.E.A/L paper marking reopens
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Four schools that were closed for the second round of the G.C.E. Advanced Level Examination paper marking reopened today (September 25).Ananda College, Colombo, Gurulogomi Vidyalaya, Kaluthara, Sudharma Vidyalaya, Galle and St. Servatius College, Mathara were reopened.The Department of Examinations confirmed that although 37 schools were used for the purpose of the second round of paper marking that only 4 schools were completely closed.

heading: New device to track fishermen
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The Department of Fisheries will be introducing a new device in order to assist authorities to locate fishing boats in distress or which have been reported missing.Director of Search and Rescue Operations at the Department of Fisheries, Padmapriya Thisera said the new devices will be handed over to the fishermen upon a directive issued by the Director-General of the Department.The new device can be retrofitted to any fishing boat and if the boat is in distress inside a respective ocean area, the boat can be located using the device.In addition, a weather report will be sent to the device of each boat via an SMS service. So far this year, 13 fishermen were reported missing and 12 fishermen lost their lives at sea.

heading: Negotiations to increase estate sector public pay
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Minister of Labour and Trade Union Affairs, Raveendra Samaraweera states that negotiations are currently underway between estate workers and their employers to increase daily wages.The Minister noted that he would intervene in the issue through a committee if discussions between the estate workers and employers fail.Negotiations began between estate workers and employers following a protest held by estate workers in Thalawakale demanding a daily wage of Rs. 1000.

heading: Mother and two daughters killed in accident
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – A mother and two daughters were killed in an accident in Akkaraipattu, Pottuvil last night (September 25). The accident took place at around 7 pm last night (September 25) near a bridge in the vicinity.Police said the accident had occurred when a car had knocked a woman crossing the road with her three children. The victims had succumbed to their injuries following admission to the Pottuvil hospital.The deceased aged 34, 12 and 6 years of age have been identified as residents of Pottuvil. The injured had been transferred to the Batticaloa hospital and a person was arrested.

heading: President to adress UNGA today
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – President Maithripala Sirisena is due to address the 73rd session of the UN General Assembly this evening (September 25) at the UN Headquarters.This year’s theme of the UNGA Session is, “Making the United Nations Relevant to All People: Global Leadership and Shared responsibilities for Peaceful, Equitable, and Sustainable Societies.”This will be President Maithripala Sirisena’s fourth address at a UN General Assembly.

heading: Rs. 10,000 as compensation for weather damage
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Secretary of the Ministry of Disaster Management, Engineer Sisira Kumara states that owing to the prevailing weather over 350 houses have been damaged.He added that a sum of Rs.10,000 is to be paid as an advance for the affected families from today (September 25).He further added that measures have been taken to estimate the cost of the damage caused and compensation to be paid.

heading: 21 hospitalized following wasp attack
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – 21 individuals were hospitalized following a wasp attack in Lulkandura, Galaha.The Police stated that the victims included 17 males and 4 females.The victims had arrived in the area on an excursion.

heading: IGP to recommend new DIG for TID
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The National Police Commission has informed the IGP to submit recommendations for the post of DIG in charge of the Terrorism Investigation Division.Secretary of the Commission, Saman Dissanayake stated the new appointment will be made based on the recommendations of the IGP.When News1st Inquired into the matter from Police Media Spokesman SP Ruwan Gunesekara, he said that recommendations for the appointment will be made soon.DIG Nalaka De Silva who has been charged with allegations of conspiring to assassinate the President and the Former Defence Secretary has been currently sent on compulsory leave.

heading: Investigation into N'eliya injection scare
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Health Minister Dr. Rajitha Senaratne has ordered for an immediate inquiry into reports which claimed that patients who received treatment from an Eye Clinic at the District General Hospital in Nuwara Eliya had experienced certain complications.The Director General of Health Services had instructed the Director of the District Hospital to immediately suspend the use of the vaccination which was used at the Eye Clinic.Reports claim 55 patients had attended the Eye Clinic which was organized recently and 17 of them were hospitalized after they had complained of certain complications. Sources said the patients are being administered with medication and they are showing positive results.The Director General of Health Services went on to note there were no reports of complications from other Hospitals where this particular medication was used. He went on to note that samples of the medication have been sent to the National Drug Quality Assurance Laboratory for tests.

heading: Former Chief of Staff granted bail
content: Colombo (News1st): President Maithripala Sirisena’s former Chief of Staff K. Mahanama and former State Timber Corporation (STC) Chairman P. Dissanayaka were granted bail today (September 25).Mahanama and Dissanayaka were in remand after being arrested for accepting a bribe of Rs.20 million. The duo were arrested at the car park of a Colombo hotel while accepting the bribe from an Indian businessman.

heading: High-speed railway project being stonewalled
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The Mawbima newspaper reported on Sunday (September 23) that the mega high-speed rail and mixed development project initiated by foreign investments worth 500 million US Dollars is being delayed with the ulterior motive of purchasing shares and obtaining commissions.The report notes that the project will provide employment opportunities to 22,000 people and receive an export revenue of 5 billion Euros. Ceylon High-Speed Railway Corporation Pvt Ltd introduced the mega high-speed rail and mixed development project to Sri Lanka. The Chairman of Ceylon High-Speed Railway Corporation Pvt Ltd Anushka Renu had written to the President complaining that the project is being delayed because some are expecting commissions.The Chairman requested the Head of State to intervene and conduct an investigation to prevent destruction from taking place by an individual appointed as the Director General of the Board of Investment. She alleges that the Director-General in question was appointed to fulfil personal requirements of a Minister and a State Minister.The Chairman goes on to note that the Secretary to the Ministry was asked not to intervene by the Minister.The letter reads on the 28th of September 2017 an official of the BOI had informed her in Milan, Italy that the BOI official in question had asked him to do what the officer instructs and to resubmit the relevant documents in order to get the project approved.

COLOMBO (News 1st) – Chairman of the Road Development Authority, Nihal Suriyarachchi states that an investigation into the sudden collapse of a part of Denzil Kobbakaduwa Mawatha adjoining parliament is currently underway.The Chairman also stated that measures have been taken to remove all electric and lamp posts from the area that collapsed.Further, the collapsed area is currently closed for reconstruction purposes.

heading: Non-compliant doctors salaries suspended
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Health minister Dr. Rajitha Senarathne has informed Heath Secretary B. G. S Gunathilaka to suspend the payment of salaries to doctors and nurses who have been transferred and have failed to report to their duties so far.A spokesperson for the Health Ministry stated that the Subject minister has also instructed for disciplinary measures to be taken against hospital directors who fail to release their transferred employees.Further, the spokesperson added that steps have been taken to suspend the funding of hospitals and awarding of promotions of directors who fail to release their transferred employees.

heading: Rainfall of 100 mm to be expected islandwide today
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Several regions experienced thundershowers accompanied by rain during the early hours today (September 25).The Meteorology Department said several areas continue to experience heavy rainfall.Rainfall experienced in the recent hours: Colombo – 79.4 mmBadulla – 45.9 mmJaffna – 33.2 mmRatmalana – 30.2 mm.The Department added that there may be temporary localised strong winds during these thundershowers. The public are kindly requested to take adequate precautions to minimize the damages caused by the adverse weather.Rainfall exceeding 100 mm can be expected in the Uva, Sabaragamuwa, Southern and Central provinces while showers or thundershowers can be expected in the Colombo, Kalutara, Galle and Matara Districts.According to the Director of the Department of Meteorology Athula Karunanayake, many parts of the island will experience rainfall exceeding 100 mm today (September 25).

heading: SL to obtain USD 480 million development grant
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Chief Operation Officer of the US Government owned Millenium challenge cooperation, Brock Bierman assured President Sirisena that the United States will provide USD 480 million to Sri Lanka for several development projects. The statement was made when Bierman had called on the President on the sidelines of the UN General Assembly.Bierman added that the approval from the Millenium Change Corporation Board of Directors and the US Congress would be obtained shortly so that the agreement with the Sri Lankan government could be signed by December this year in Colombo.He also invited President Sirisena to grace the signing ceremony in Colombo.The grant will be utilized for several development projects including transport infrastructure development, road development, bus modernisation, control of traffic congestion and traffic management.   It was a pleasure meeting with the CEO of Millennium Challenge Corporation, Brock D. Bierman to talk about strengthening bilateral cooperation. heading: Fonseka arrives at CID
content: Minister, Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka arrived at the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) to give statement pertaining to the abduction and assault on journalist Keith Noyahr.

heading: Govt silent as underworld gains power - MR
content: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa has said that the Government is maintaining silence when the underworld is gaining power.He made this observation at a religious ceremony in Embilipitiya yesterday.

heading: Police launch probe on Kuliyapitiya mobile phone theft
content: Kuliyapitiya police have launched an investigation over the theft of a mobile phone belonging to a customer who had come to a crude oil shop.According to CCTV footages obtained by the police, the customer who was on a call had left it in the shop by mistake.Footages also show a person who had later arrived in a three-wheeler taking the phone along with him.

heading: Salaries of doctors and nurses who have not reported to work after transfer halted
content: The Health Ministry has announced that salaries of Doctors and nurses who have been transferred and who have not reported to work will not be paid.

heading: IP Rangajewa granted bail
content: IP Neomal Rangajeewa who was arrested over the Welikada Prison riots in 2012, was granted bail by the Court of Appeal today.Rangajeewa was arrested by the CID on March 28 over allegations of killing prison inmates during the Welikada prison riots in November 2012.

heading: Health Ministry warns of possible dengue threat
content: The Epidemiology Unit of the Health Ministry has warned of a possible dengue threat owing to the rainy conditions experienced in various parts of the country.Accordingly, a mosquito eradication week will e observed from tomorrow.So far 38,000 dengue patients have been reported this year.

heading: Court permits CID to record voice samples of former TID Chief
content: The Colombo Fort Magistrate has permitted the CID to direct former Director of the Terrorism Investigation Division (TID), DIG Nalaka de Silva to the Government Analyst’s Department to record voice samples.Director Operations of the Anti-Corruption Force, Namal Kumara has also been instructed to appear before the Government Analyst’s Department on Wednesday (26) for the same purpose.Kumara had recently accused DIG Nalaka de Silva of allegedly conspiring to assassinate President Maithripala Sirisena and former Defense Secretary Gotabaya Rajapaksa.

heading: Ambepussa Soldier murder an inside job.
content: Police investigations have revealed that two soldiers from the same camp were involved in the recent murder of a soldier at Ambepussa Army Camp.A senior officer who conducted the investigation stated that the assailants had stolen the victim's service weapon for criminal activities.The officer stated that the two suspects will be arrested soon.The post-mortem on the body of the deceased revealed that he was attacked with a sharp object causing fatal injuries to his heart.The 21-year old victim was a resident of Bulathkohupitiya.

heading: Duminda calls politicians to unite for country's development
content: Minister Duminda Dissanayake has called upon political parties to keep aside political differences and unite for the development of the country.He made this call when he was at Kahatagasgiliya area, assessing the damages caused by inclement weather conditions.

heading: Police takes steps to take the duo who posed indecently atop Pidurangala
content: Police have taken steps to take into custody the two individuals who had posed in an obscene manner atop Pidurangala.A photograph of the two had been circulated which had prompted officials to take action against them.Accordingly, the duo has been identified and police have already taken steps to take them into custody.

heading: Thundershpwers up to 100mm expected
content: The Department of Meteorology has predicted thundershowers of up to 100mm with strong winds in the Western, Sabaragamuwa, Eastern, Uva, North Central, Central and Southern provinces in the coming days.

heading: Fmr Chief of Staff and STC Chairman given bail
content: Former Presidential Chief of Staff I.K. Mahanama and former chairman of the State Timber Corporation (STC), P. Dissanayake who were arrested for soliciting Rs. 20 bribe have been granted bail.

heading: Gnanasara Thera admitted to Sri Jayawardenapura Hospital for further treatment
content: General Secretary of the Bodu Bala Sena (BBS) Organisation, Ven. Galagoda Aththe Gnanasara Thera who was taken to Sri Jayawardenapura Hospital for a scheduled clinic has been admitted for further treatment.

heading: Individual critically injured after being hit by a train in Hatton
content: One individual was severely injured in a railway accident in Hatton.The accident was reported to have taken place adjacent to the Hatton railway station.The individual had collided with the train which was travelling towards Badulla from Colombo.

heading: Fonseka leaves CID after recording statement
content: Minister Field Marshal Sarath Fonseka left the CID after giving a statement regarding the abduction and assault on journalist Keith Noyahr.The Minister had recorded a statement at the CID for more than 4 hours regarding the case.

heading: Four injured in Ambalanthota road accident
content: Four individuals belonging to one family were injured in an accident reported in Ambalanthota along the Mathara-Tissamaharama road last night.Police said injured have been admitted to hospital and none of them is in critical condition.

heading: USA pledges US$ 480 million for SL development projects
content: The United States has pledged to provide a grant of US$ 480 million for various development projects, the President’s Media Division said.TChief Operation Officer of US Government owned Millennium Challenge Cooperation (MCC), Brock Bierman gave this assurance when he met President Maithrpala Sirisena at the Lowes Regency Hotel in New York yesterday (24).

heading: Ranil discusses with current and former Maldivian President
content: Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe has held discussions with the former president of the Maldives, Abdullah Yameem.Wickremesinghe in a telephone conversation had expressed his happiness over the manner in which the elections were held.The Premier had also conveyed his wishes to the newly elected President, Ibrahim Mohamed Solih.

heading: Woman dies in road accident in Kochchikade
content: A 33-year-old woman had died in an accident in Kochchikade today.According to reports, the woman who had been been a pillion rider on a motorbike had collided with a concrete mixer.It is reported that her husband was riding the motorbike. The accident had taken place due to reckless driving by the victim's husband.

heading: Families affected in Rajiv Gandhi suicide attack oppose release of convicts
content: Families who were affected by the suicide attack on former Indian Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi are expected to meet the Tamil Nadu Governor.The families have opposed the move by Tamil Nadu State Government to call for the release of those convicted of the murder of the former prime minister.Accordingly, the families had requested a meeting with the Governor to express their concerns.

heading: Sritharan leaves for Geneva to attend UN Human Rights Council sessions
content: TNA Parliamentarian S. Sritharan has left for Geneva to take part at the UN Human Rights Council sessions.Speaking to the media before his departure, Sritharan said that he was travelling to Geneva in his personal capacity and not as a TNA representative.

heading: With Ranil at the forefront UNP won't rise in 2020
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – Speaking at an event, Former General Secretary of the UNP, Tissa Attanayake stated that the path that his former party (UNP) is on is not a people friendly one. Although the people were hoping for a change they have only been led to disappointment, he stated.Attanayake also stated that if the 2020 Presidential Poll is contested by UNP leader, Ranil Wickremasinghe at the forefront,  the party would not be able to rise, because the people seek new alternatives for leadership.He continued to say, that although there are many opportunities to select a possible candidate for the 2020 elections the UNP also seek leaders from elsewhere.“—– This country created great leaders who brought about great development. I believe, if they can select a leader of that caliber, the UNP can move ahead. As Party Leader if Ranil Wickremasinghe does not open the party, there will be internal conflicts—-” added Attanayake.

heading: Showers to be expected in many areas
content: COLOMBO (News 1st) – The Department of Meteorology said showers exceeding 100 mm can be expected in several parts of the country.The highest rainfall in the past 24 hours was reported from Rathmalana which was 90mm. 77mm of rainfall was reported from Mattala while 85 mm of rainfall was reported in Colombo. Duty Meteorologist Buddhika Bandurathne said that rainfall exceeding 100mm can be expected in a number of districts today.The Meteorology department added that showers or thundershowers will occur in the Northern, Eastern, North-central, Uva and Central provinces and in the Galle, Matara, Kaluthara and Kurunegala districts after 2.00 p.m. Showers or thundershowers will occur at several places in the Sabaragamuwa province as well. Several spells of light showers will occur in the coastal areas of the Western and North-western provinces in the morning (September 24).Gale winds that swept through Kirimetiyawa, Kahatagasdigiliya caused considerable damage to houses in the area. Several injuries were also reported.

heading: Weather: Over 100 mm Rainfall in parts of SL
content: COLOMBO (News 1st): The Meteorology Department has forecast over 100 mm of rain across several areas in Sri Lanka.Rainfall in the past 24 hours (highest to lowest);Habarana – 131.5 mmColombo – 114.1 mmRatmalana – 94.2 mmMattala – 77.1 mm.Meanwhile, gale winds that swept across many villages in Kahatagasdigiliya, Anuradhapura caused considerable damage to around 80 houses, leaving 6 houses completely destroyed.Uprooted trees also disrupted the supply of electricity to the area.The flip sideThe Anuradhapura Town and Polonnaruwa Town experienced heavy rain today (September 24).
